field_leadership.title: Brett Rusch

breadcrumbs.title: VA White River Junction Health Care

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Brett Rusch | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Brett Rusch, MD, was appointed Executive Director for the White River Junction VA Medical Center and its seven Community-Based Outpatient Clinics on April 28, 2019.
Veterans Affairs
Brett Rusch | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs
Brett Rusch, MD, was appointed Executive Director for the White River Junction VA Medical Center and its seven Community-Based Outpatient Clinics on April 28, 2019.
https://dsva-vagov-staging-cms-files.s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/styles/3_2_medium_thumbnail/public/2021-11/B.Rusch%2011.03.2021%20headshot%202.jpg
Executive Director

attributes.name: twitter:card
attributes.content: summary_large_image

attributes.name: twitter:site
attributes.content: @DeptVetAffairs

attributes.name: twitter:description
attributes.content: Brett Rusch, MD, was appointed Executive Director for the White River Junction VA Medical Center and its seven Community-Based Outpatient Clinics on April 28, 2019.

attributes.name: twitter:title
attributes.content: Brett Rusch | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: twitter:image
attributes.content: https://dsva-vagov-staging-cms-files.s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/styles/3_2_medium_thumbnail/public/2021-11/B.Rusch%2011.03.2021%20headshot%202.jpg

attributes.name: twitter:image:alt
attributes.content: Executive Director

field_body.value:
He is a practicing psychiatrist and mental health expert, and has been providing care to Veterans throughout his medical career. Additionally, Dr. Rusch is active as an Assistant Professor of Psychiatry at Dartmouth's Geisel School of Medicine, and as White River Junction’s Executive Director he represents VA as an ex-officio member of Geisel’s Board of Advisors.

Dr. Rusch received a Bachelor's Degree in Psychology from the University of Wisconsin and completed his medical degree and a psychiatry residency at the University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health (UWSMPH).

Dr. Rusch originally joined the White River Junction VA in 2015 as the Chief of Mental Health and Behavioral Science Services. He then served as Chief of Staff from December 2016 through April 2019. Prior to joining the White River Junction team, Dr. Rusch served as Director of Inpatient and Intensive Outpatient Mental Health Services at the William S. Middleton Memorial Veterans Hospital in Madison, WI. During his tenure at the Madison VA Hospital, he was on the faculty at the UWSMPH, where he received the Department of Psychiatry's Award for Excellence in Resident Education for the three consecutive academic years bridging 2012-2015.
field_body.processed:

Additionally, Dr. Rusch is active as an Assistant Professor of Psychiatry at Dartmouth's Geisel School of Medicine, and as White River Junction’s Executive Director he represents VA as an ex-officio member of Geisel’s Board of Advisors.

Dr. Rusch received a Bachelor's Degree in Psychology from the University of Wisconsin and completed his medical degree and a psychiatry residency at the University of Wisconsin School of Medicine and Public Health (UWSMPH).

Dr. Rusch originally joined the White River Junction VA in 2015 as the Chief of Mental Health and Behavioral Science Services. He then served as Chief of Staff from December 2016 through April 2019. Prior to joining the White River Junction team, Dr. Rusch served as Director of Inpatient and Intensive Outpatient Mental Health Services at the William S. Middleton Memorial Veterans Hospital in Madison, WI. During his tenure at the Madison VA Hospital, he was on the faculty at the UWSMPH, where he received the Department of Psychiatry's Award for Excellence in Resident Education for the three consecutive academic years bridging 2012-2015.

field_leadership.field_intro_text: Brett Rusch, MD, was appointed Executive Director for the White River Junction VA Medical Center and its seven Community-Based Outpatient Clinics on April 28, 2019.

field_leadership.title: Becky Rhoads

breadcrumbs.title: VA White River Junction Health Care

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Becky Rhoads | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Dr. Becky (Daley) Rhoads, Au.D., was appointed as the facility’s Associate Director in August, 2018.
Veterans Affairs
Becky Rhoads | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs
Dr. Becky (Daley) Rhoads, Au.D., was appointed as the facility’s Associate Director in August, 2018.
https://dsva-vagov-staging-cms-files.s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/styles/3_2_medium_thumbnail/public/2022-11/B.Rhoads%2010.2022%20internet.jpg
Becky Rhoads, AuD Headshot

attributes.name: twitter:card
attributes.content: summary_large_image

attributes.name: twitter:site
attributes.content: @DeptVetAffairs

attributes.name: twitter:description
attributes.content: Dr. Becky (Daley) Rhoads, Au.D., was appointed as the facility’s Associate Director in August, 2018.

attributes.name: twitter:title
attributes.content: Becky Rhoads | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: twitter:image
attributes.content: https://dsva-vagov-staging-cms-files.s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/styles/3_2_medium_thumbnail/public/2022-11/B.Rhoads%2010.2022%20internet.jpg

attributes.name: twitter:image:alt
attributes.content: Becky Rhoads, AuD Headshot

field_body.value:
Dr. Becky Rhoads began her VA career at the White River Junction VA Medical Center in June, 2009. She was a staff audiologist and was then selected for the Chief of Audiology position, where she served until 2016 when she moved to health care administration. Dr. Rhoads has extensive experience in outpatient clinical care for Veterans and health care administration. Dr. Rhoads was appointed the Associate Director for the White River Junction VA Healthcare System in August, 2018 and has served in that role since that time. She has formally been detailed as Interim Director for two VA facilities: the White River Junction VA Healthcare System in 2021 and the Lexington VA Health Care System in Lexington, Kentucky in 2022.  Dr. Rhoads is also a 2017 graduate of the premier VA Health Care Leadership Development Program and a 2021 graduate of the Senior Executive Assessment Program.

Dr. Rhoads is a graduate of the University of Vermont with a dual degree in Communication Sciences and Psychology. She earned a Doctorate in Audiology from Northeastern University in 2008. Dr. Rhoads is a Rutland, Vermont native and she currently resides in the Upper Valley with her family.

She has formally been detailed as Interim Director for two VA facilities: the White River Junction VA Healthcare System in 2021 and the Lexington VA Health Care System in Lexington, Kentucky in 2022.  Dr. Rhoads is also a 2017 graduate of the premier VA Health Care Leadership Development Program and a 2021 graduate of the Senior Executive Assessment Program.

Dr. Rhoads is a graduate of the University of Vermont with a dual degree in Communication Sciences and Psychology. She earned a Doctorate in Audiology from Northeastern University in 2008. Dr. Rhoads is a Rutland, Vermont native and she currently resides in the Upper Valley with her family.

breadcrumbs.title: VA White River Junction Health Care

attributes.content: Daniel O'Rouke | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Daniel O'Rourke, MD, joined the staff at the White River Junction VA Medical Center in 1996.
Veterans Affairs
Daniel O'Rouke | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs
Daniel O'Rourke, MD, joined the staff at the White River Junction VA Medical Center in 1996.
https://dsva-vagov-staging-cms-files.s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/styles/3_2_medium_thumbnail/public/2021-11/COS.Headshot.Orourke-cropped.jpg

attributes.content: summary_large_image

attributes.name: twitter:description
attributes.content: Daniel O'Rourke, MD, joined the staff at the White River Junction VA Medical Center in 1996.

attributes.name: twitter:title
attributes.content: Daniel O'Rouke | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: twitter:image
attributes.content: https://dsva-vagov-staging-cms-files.s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/styles/3_2_medium_thumbnail/public/2021-11/COS.Headshot.Orourke-cropped.jpg

attributes.name: twitter:image:alt
attributes.content: Chief of Staff

field_body.value: Upon graduating as valedictorian from Siena College, Dr. O’Rourke earned his MD with magna cum laude honors at the SUNY at Syracuse and completed internal medicine training at the University of Pittsburgh where he was recognized with an award for outstanding teaching. He completed his cardiology fellowship at DHMC in 1996, followed by a master’s degree from the Center for Evaluative Clinical Sciences from Dartmouth College in 1997. He earned a master’s degree in education from Xavier University in 2017. He is board certified in internal medicine, cardiovascular disease and nuclear cardiology, and holds an academic appointment with the Geisel School of Medicine at Dartmouth as an Associate Professor of Medicine. He has been a very popular clinical teacher and has >50 abstracts and publications in peer-reviewed journals. In his spare time, Dan coaches the girls’ varsity basketball team at Hanover High School (Hanover, NH).
field_body.processed: Upon graduating as valedictorian from Siena College, Dr. O’Rourke earned his MD with magna cum laude honors at the SUNY at Syracuse and completed internal medicine training at the University of Pittsburgh where he was recognized with an award for outstanding teaching. He completed his cardiology fellowship at DHMC in 1996, followed by a master’s degree from the Center for Evaluative Clinical Sciences from Dartmouth College in 1997. He earned a master’s degree in education from Xavier University in 2017. He is board certified in internal medicine, cardiovascular disease and nuclear cardiology, and holds an academic appointment with the Geisel School of Medicine at Dartmouth as an Associate Professor of Medicine. He has been a very popular clinical teacher and has >50 abstracts and publications in peer-reviewed journals. In his spare time, Dan coaches the girls’ varsity basketball team at Hanover High School (Hanover, NH).

field_leadership.title: Kelley Saindon

breadcrumbs.title: VA White River Junction Health Care

attributes.name: title
attributes.content: Kelley Saindon | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: description
attributes.content: Dr. Kelley Saindon, DNP, RN, NE-BC, CHPN joined the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) in 2001 as a Nursing Assistant at VA Bedford Healthcare System and proudly served continuously for twenty-one years before coming to White River Junction in 2022 to become Associate Director of Nursing and Patient Care Services.
Veterans Affairs
Kelley Saindon | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

Dr. Kelley Saindon, DNP, RN, NE-BC, CHPN joined the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) in 2001 as a Nursing Assistant at VA Bedford Healthcare System and proudly served continuously for twenty-one years before coming to White River Junction in 2022 to become Associate Director of Nursing and Patient Care Services.
https://dsva-vagov-staging-cms-files.s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/styles/3_2_medium_thumbnail/public/2022-12/K.Saindon_12.20.2022.jpg
Dr. Kelley Saindon Headshot

attributes.name: twitter:card
attributes.content: summary_large_image

attributes.name: twitter:site
attributes.content: @DeptVetAffairs

attributes.name: twitter:description
attributes.content: Dr. Kelley Saindon, DNP, RN, NE-BC, CHPN joined the Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) in 2001 as a Nursing Assistant at VA Bedford Healthcare System and proudly served continuously for twenty-one years before coming to White River Junction in 2022 to become Associate Director of Nursing and Patient Care Services.

attributes.name: twitter:title
attributes.content: Kelley Saindon | VA White River Junction health care | Veterans Affairs

attributes.name: twitter:image
attributes.content: https://dsva-vagov-staging-cms-files.s3.us-gov-west-1.amazonaws.com/styles/3_2_medium_thumbnail/public/2022-12/K.Saindon_12.20.2022.jpg

attributes.name: twitter:image:alt
attributes.content: Dr. Kelley Saindon Headshot

field_body.value:
Dr. Saindon’s tenure includes a diverse work history including Nursing Informatics, Geriatrics, and Hospice and Palliative Care. She moved into administration as the Nurse Manager of the Inpatient Hospice Unit from 2015-2017. Dr. Saindon continues to serve as a coach and mentor for fellow colleagues and Nurse Managers while promoting ongoing development and higher education. Striving for optimal patient care outcomes is one of her top priorities, she improves the quality-of-care delivery by implementing evidence-based practices.

Dr. Saindon was the Geriatrics and Extended Care (GEC) Service Line Manager at VA Bedford Healthcare System, with oversight over one of the largest Community Living Centers (CLC) in the nation, achieving a 5-star CLC designation and being awarded Age-Friendly recognition in 2021. She acted as the VA New England Healthcare System (VISN1) GEC Director from March 2020 -March 2021 where she provided oversight to the GEC programs throughout New England navigating the CLC response to the unprecedented COVID-19 pandemic. Dr. Saindon was the Deputy Nurse Executive of Patient Care Services from 2019-2021. As the Deputy Nurse Executive she provided leadership and strategic direction for the CLC and Mental Health inpatient nursing services at VA Bedford. Prior to this appointment, she served as the Associate Chief Nurse of Patient Care Services from 2017-2019. She served as VA Bedford’s Integrated Ethics Program Officer from 2018-2022. Dr. Saindon is a 2022 graduate of VA Health Care Leadership Development Program. She serves as a Board Director of Nurses Organization of Veteran Affairs (NOVA), she elevates the profession to optimize Veteran care through education, communication, and advocacy for VA nurses. She is an active member of the Academy of Health Care Executives.

Dr. Saindon received her undergraduate BSN from Rivier College, in New Hampshire and her MSN from the University of Phoenix, in Arizona. She holds Nurse Executive and Hospice and Palliative Care board certifications. Dr. Saindon received her Doctorate of Nursing Practice in May 2020 from University of Massachusetts Lowell. She has held professional appointments to both University of Massachusetts, Boston and Middlesex Community College, Bedford. Her love for teaching the emerging nursing professionals is profound. She enjoys the great New England outdoors year-round with her family. She stays busy keeping up with her children sport engagements and assists with coaching.

Dr. Saindon was the Deputy Nurse Executive of Patient Care Services from 2019-2021. As the Deputy Nurse Executive she provided leadership and strategic direction for the CLC and Mental Health inpatient nursing services at VA Bedford. She is an active member of the Academy of Health Care Executives.

She holds Nurse Executive and Hospice and Palliative Care board certifications. Dr. Saindon received her Doctorate of Nursing Practice in May 2020 from University of Massachusetts Lowell.
